what: Look for breaks in sequences of time blocks — consolidate_time_blocks
title: Look for breaks in sequences of time blocks — consolidate_time_blocks
text: Developed help work fishing regulation data. consolidate_time_blocks takes number rows, column start end dates, consolidates contiguous periods dates single one (row output represents period one days break last one). Moreover, function uses clipr package use system clipboard. can copy block dates excel (like screenshot) run function arguments pull copied cells run calculations.

title: Look for breaks in sequences of time blocks — consolidate_time_blocks
Look for breaks in sequences of time blocks — consolidate_time_blocks
text: .data Dataframe. Optional; provided, instead use system clipboard (assumes contains copy 2-column excel block) start_col Name column containing start dates. Defaults "start". Unused .data provided. end_col Name column containing end dates. Defaults "start". Unused .data provided.

title: Look for breaks in sequences of time blocks — consolidate_time_blocks
text: Tibble start end date non-contiguous period, length days

title: Look for breaks in sequences of time blocks — consolidate_time_blocks
code: library(tidyr) #> Error in library(tidyr): there is no package called ‘tidyr’ df = tribble( ~ start, ~end_date, "2024-8-1", "2024-8-5", "2024-8-6", "2024-8-10", "2024-8-16", "2024-8-30" ) #> Error in tribble(~start, ~end_date, "2024-8-1", "2024-8-5", "2024-8-6",     "2024-8-10", "2024-8-16", "2024-8-30"): could not find function "tribble" df |> consolidate_time_blocks(end_col = "end_date") #column name for start column is the default, "start" #> ! If dates are in ambiguous format, making best guess. Check years of output! #> Error in .data[[start_col]]: object of type 'closure' is not subsettable
